will-not-bow.context: Mordecai refuses to bow to Haman
will-not-bow.english: He neither rose nor trembled before him

scattered-people.hebrew: יֶשְׁנוֹ עַם אֶחָד מְפֻזָּר וּמְפֹרָד בֵּין הָעַמִּים
scattered-people.english: There is a certain people scattered and dispersed among the peoples

their-laws-different.context: Haman argues for destruction of Jews
their-laws-different.english: Their laws are different from those of every other people

destroy-all-jews.hebrew: לְהַשְׁמִיד לַהֲרֹג וּלְאַבֵּד אֶת כָּל הַיְּהוּדִים
destroy-all-jews.english: To destroy, to kill, and to annihilate all Jews

fifty-cubits-gallows.english: Let a gallows fifty cubits high be made

whom-king-delights.context: Haman assumes he is the honoree
whom-king-delights.hebrew: לְמִי יַחְפֹּץ הַמֶּלֶךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת יְקָר יוֹתֵר מִמֶּנִּי
whom-king-delights.english: Whom would the king wish to honor more than me?

fallen-before-mordecai.hebrew: אִם מִזֶּרַע הַיְּהוּדִים מָרְדֳּכַי... נָפוֹל תִּפּוֹל לְפָנָיו
fallen-before-mordecai.english: If Mordecai is of Jewish descent... you will surely fall before him
